FuncDef:
The display temperature command displays the status and configuration of the temperature sensor on a specified board.
The display temperature mpu command displays the status and configuration of the temperature sensor on the main control board.
The display voltage command displays the status and configuration of the voltage sensor on a specified board.
The display voltage mpu command displays the status and configuration of the voltage sensor on the main control board.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a slot ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies a PIC ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 16.

Specifies an ID for an AP.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Examples: PCB          I2C Addr Chl Status   Require MajorL FatalL MajorH FatalH Vlt(V) Ratio
PCB          I2C ADDr Chl Status   Minor Major Fatal FanTMin FanTMax Temp(C)
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
During routine maintenance, you can run the display temperature command to check whether the temperature of a device is within a normal range and locate the fault.
During routine maintenance or when a fault occurs on a device, you can run the display voltage command to check whether the voltage of the device is within a normal range and locate the fault.
Precautions
If the output of the display temperature command indicates that the Status of the device is not NORMAL, adjust the working temperature to ensure proper operation of the device.
The normal working temperature of a device ranges from 0degreeC to 45degreeC. If the output of the display temperature mpu command indicates that the working temperature is out of range, adjust the working temperature to ensure proper operation of the device.
For the voltage scope in which the device works properly, refer to the Hardware Description. If the output of the display voltage command indicates that the current working voltage of the device is out of the scope, adjust the working voltage to ensure the proper running of the device.
For the voltage scope in which the device works properly, refer to the Hardware Description. If the output of the display voltage mpu command indicates that the current working voltage of the device is out of the scope, adjust the working voltage to ensure the proper running of the device.
For subcards CR5D00P8E870, CR5D00P8E871 and CR5D00CFE171, two slots (0 and 2) or (1 and 3) will be displayed.
